meanings.definition: The main root of a plant that grows straight down into the ground.
meanings.sent1: The taproots of the tree help it stay firmly in the soil.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts recommend nurturing taproots for healthy plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The taproots had a race to see who could reach the bottom of the pot first.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the taproots of a mighty oak, firmly grounded and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The taproots, like anchors, kept the plant stable during the storm.

meanings.definition: A central or main source of something.
meanings.sent1: The library was the taproots of knowledge for the students.
meanings.sent2: Family traditions serve as the taproots of our cultural identity.
meanings.sent3: His love for music was the taproots of his happiness.
meanings.sent4: The taproots of inspiration ran deep within her soul.
meanings.sent5: Friendship acts as the taproots of support during tough times.
